name: Columbus Hotel

reviews.text: This old building used to house vatican city staff about 400 years ago. It is a beautiful building really close to the vatican. Rooms are basic but clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was very good with a wide selection of food and drinks. Dining room is beautifully decorated with frescoes and there is a lovely garden where you can eat if the weather is good. Metro station about 10 mins walk but everywhere walkable as the city is not massive. Top tip..wear comfy shoes as pavements are cobbled and can be very uncomfortable for your feet! We also found a bus service from the airport which dropped off nearby and was cheaper than a taxi
reviews.title: fabulously located for St Peter's

reviews.text: Great location, particularly for the Vatican. Historic building with interesting features. Could be really good but unfortunately the rooms are more akin to monk's cells. They are not exactly dirty but they look tired and give the impression that all previous occupants were heavy smokers. We were unfortunately on the top floor within the roof space which meant the temperature was on one occasion too high to sleep as the air conditioning was totally inadequate. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Historic hotel more suited to the dark ages.

reviews.text: I stayed here last September. This hotel is awesome. Our rate included the breakfast which was much appreciated. We didn't eat the dinner there due to the prices but there were a ton of small restaurants within a few blocks. I liked staying so close to Vatican city. The staff were all very polite and helpful and the rooms were fine. Probably more spacious than most european hotels. The weather was perfect - not too hot and the air conditioner worked well. They also called taxis for us when we needed them. I can't say enough about Rome. I loved it.
reviews.title: Hotel Columbus awesome!

reviews.text: 15 th century monastery a hotel since 1950. . The common areas are beautiful and authentic with fresco ceilings and cobbled or parquet floors. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was a bit shocking we felt like we walked into a prison cell or a room you might have for summer camp! It even had a funny stale odor to go along with it ( which improved after we turned on the air ) The carpet looked very dirty we kept our shoes on the whole time except while we were sleeping. They have a lovely restaurant in an ancient courtyard were lots of locals were eating . Food was delicious but expensive .
reviews.title: 15th century hotel exquisite , falls short on room appeal and cleanliness

reviews.text: My advice unless you need to be near the vatican choose another hotel there are plenty of ancient ruins in Rome but you don't have to sleep there !
reviews.title: not four star but..

reviews.text: This hotel is located down the street from St. Peter’s Square. The building is was built in the 15th century and it has very impressive public areas. The hotel rooms themselves very greatly in size and features. While we had a modest double room, our traveling companions had a triple room with vaulted ceiling and frescos on the walls. The location of the hotel is excellent for visiting the Vatican and Rome. Being so close to the Vatican did have a disadvantage however, the streets around the hotel are closed to vehicular traffic for the Wednesday general audience of the Pope. Of course, that is the day we arrived and had to tote our luggage for two blocks. If you appreciate historical buildings this hotel is right for you. If you prefer all the modern convenience of 4 or 5 star hotel, this may not be the place for you. The hotel has only one small (4 persons max) elevator that did break down while we were staying there. They had it back in service the next day but we did count 96 steps to our floor. Also the air conditioning is very poor running intermittently and never really cooling the room. The hotel serves a breakfast for 15 Euros which we did not try. There are several cafes nearby that you can get coffee and breakfast foods. We particularly enjoyed the Gran Caffe Borgo on Borgo Pio. All in all, I would definitely stay here again both not in the summer and I would request a more ornate room.
reviews.title: Nice historical hotel with a few drawbacks

reviews.text: We just stayed at this nice hotel - full of personality, and literally steps from the Vatican. We were there to spend time at St. Peters and see the new Pope. The Columbus did not disappoint! It was a dream come true to be so close to St. Peters. I discovered the hotel is actually a 15th century former convent, brimming with history. It isn't perfect- it isn't the Ritz Carlton but we were not expecting the Ritz Carlton.
reviews.title: Fantastic---location- location- location!

reviews.text: Yes if you are a fussy person- you are just going to see the faults but we loved it and we were grateful to be able to stay at the Columbus Hotel- we were lucky to get a room- we embraced the charm of the hotel. Grazie!
reviews.title: very disappointing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thrilled with our stay! We will be back in December!
reviews.title: Shambles - Spoilt Our Break in Roma

reviews.text: Arrived to be told 2 of 3 rooms weren,t ready.Given other rooms but had to vacate them the next day -----we refused.The accommodation on fourth floor ---lighting, mirror, woefully
reviews.title: Wonderful Location, Bad Accomodation

reviews.text: This could be a great hotel and seems like it will be until you get to the room. I liken it to a prison cell-bare and dirty. Walls were dingy yellowish, "upholstered" headboard noticeably dirty. Tiny chair-didn't want to touch it- just used it for dirty clothes. Desk, armoire, and tv stand all old and ratty. Small tv from like 1980 with maybe 8 channels. Wifi a joke-got kicked off every few minutes and had to re-enter code every time. Agents at desk seemed annoye to be bothered. We booked this thru a travel site and had no choice but to stay or would have left.
reviews.title: Don't bother!

reviews.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. While the location is amazing and the building itself is incredible, the rooms are disgusting. I thought I would catch something off the carpet. The shower was a whole bathroom affair. So disgusting.
reviews.title: Gross

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was the only thing going for this place. The carpet in my room was thread bearen as well as dirty. As mentioned in other's post the TV was older than me. We were only able to turn it on once and that was when a hotel staff member came up to plug in the coax cable for us. The air conditioner was not in use, we were told that they would not be turned on until June. It was very warm and humid outside and I could have used the coolness of the air conditioner. The streets by the vatican was very noisy and could be heard with the windows open or closed. We also had a mosquito problem. The breakfast room was tiny and we had to wait for a table to be cleaned off before we could eat. I could have overlooked the breakfast staff's unfriendliness if the cappuccino wasn't cold.
reviews.title: Not a four star by any means

reviews.text: I am at a loss to understand why some reviewers seem to love this place. It is housed in one of the beautiful old buildings lining the main approach to St.Peter's, the Via Conciliacione and the entrance is through an arch towards the rear courtyard and it looks lovely especially at night. For me, the romance ended there. The staff were perfectly friendly and helpful and mostly speak English if that matters. The building is, indeed, old but that can mean dingy or quaint or several other adjectives which might also apply. Well past it's best would be my view.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.text: I was first given a single room by mistake which was tiny. It had no aircon and a window opening to the, surprisingly noisy side street. Many of Rome's quaint side streets may not have that much traffic but the cobbles ensure that what there is makes a lot of noise. There was no shower, only a bath with one of those annoying shower mixers that you have to hold over your head if you want a shower. The tv was an antique small portable tube type and the carpet was probably once a burgundy colour but must be one of the filthiest looking carpets I've ever seen in a hotel.
reviews.title: not a 4 star hotel...

reviews.text: The location is a great spot to be for checking out the Vatican, which is for what we were looking but not great for much else. There are not many interesting restaurants or cafes or even bars nearby. The A/C was not strong enough to keep it very comfortable in the room as many other June travelers noted. They also told us they only turn the A/C on 13:00-16:00 and 22:00-02:00, which made it tough when we returned to the room at 18:00 after visiting the Vatican and having dinner with nothing else interesting to do in the area to find the room still sweltering. The room was huge (we had a triple) as was the bathroom though the shower itself smaller but not bad for European standards. The building is a 15th century monastery with tons of character and with that comes some of the musty smells, lots of stairs, and other issues of such an old building. My mother couldn't stand it, though I can take it in stride as the price for something historic and unusual. The front desk staff were very helpful. There is a shuttle that can be arranged to the airport at anytime of day/night for only 25Euro each.
reviews.title: Great location for the Vatican

reviews.text: No real frills, but a very convenient and clean hotel. Just steps from St Peters. I would stay there again. The staff was entirely friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was enjoyable. Definitely served it's purpose.
reviews.title: Location!

reviews.text: The hotel for character but during this stay the temperature was in the mid 30's and the heat in the rooms were unbearable with the air conditioning unable to cope
reviews.title: No air conditioning at the Columbus!
